alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 5:31AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding along the Sandusky River caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following county, Crawford. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 AM EDT, the river stage along the Sandusky River at Bucyrus was 8.09 feet and rising at 430 AM EDT. - At 8.5 feet, the Sandusky River is out of its banks in multiple locations in Bucyrus. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bucyrus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
